passage_text: Depending on the sophistication of your car key you may be able to have a new electronic key programmed by a locksmith. Many new car keys have a microchip in them to prevent duplication. However, if you have a key with a transponder in it you can probably get a new one at a locksmith for around $50.00. Manufacturers started using transponders in the 1990’s – they are chips in the head of the key that communicate with the car. If the wrong key is in the ignition, the car will not start

Go to your Chrysler dealership or locksmith's office. Provide them with the VIN number, year and model of your vehicle. If your key has a computer chip in the fob, your local dealer and locksmith can determine what it is based on the VIN. Wait while your new key is created and pay the fee for the replacement. If you lost the key or just need a key copy, first, you will need to find out what kind of key your truck requires, and if there is a chip inside the key or not. We can make new keys, repair keys, and program them. 1 You can buy a transponder chip key blank online or at a locksmith shop. 2  You can also get one at a Dodge dealership. 3  Pick one of the working keys and copy it to your new key. 4  You can also have the key copied at different hardware stores.

A locksmith cannot make you a key for a car. You need to call a dealership (i.e. if it's a chevy call a chevy dealership) with your VIN number and if it's not real old they can get the key codes to cut you a new key.
